name: David Hall
text: We use Stegall for all our HVAC work and have been for the past 10 years.  They are the best at customer service.  Their technicians arrive when scheduled, are always polite and courteous, and our HVAC never goes out.  Joe Ryder, our technician this year, was great!  I highly recommend.

name: Harrison Bender
text: Joe Rider is great. He has been to my home for service on multiple occasions and is always incredibly polite and on time. Service is great with Stegall.

name: Jeff Owens
text: Love this company. I really appreciate Joe and all he did to fix our air conditioning. I am so happy with my experience with Stegall and highly recommend them!

name: David Coram
text: I had an after hours HVAC emergency at my home.  It was hot and the HVAC would not come on. It was around Midnight on a Friday night when I called Stegall. Joe Rider was on call and came right out in about 30 minutes, and got us up and running in about 20 minutes.  He was courteous, kind, and had a great attitude to be up so late.  I wish I could hire more people like Joe to work for me!!

name: Drew Lansdell
text: Stegall has been very professional in my experience with them. I have requested two homes receive an HVAC inspection prior to purchase, and Joe has performed both. I would highly recommend the service.

name: Cathy Gibson
text: Woke up July 3rd. No air. Twenty guests expected for a Fourth of July celebration!  Shelly was extremely helpful in the office and Joe the technician came out and had us up and running in no time. Thanks Stegall!!

name: Susan Smith
text: Very prompt and courteous service in the middle of the night to get our air conditioning working. We were so grateful!

name: Shane Gates
text: From the office staff to the guys on the field, everyone is fantastic! I've had work in plumbing, electrical, and HVAC. Brandon, Chuck, Justin, Nick, and Quentin are professional, personable and knowledgeable. Shelly who works in the office is priceless! This company has the best employees you could ask for! I would recommend them to everyone.

name: Nancy Prater
text: Excellent service! I appreciate the prompt response to my initial phone call. I can't remember the last time technicians have covered my floors with protective sheets. I have already recommended them to my co-workers!

name: G Weldon
text: Have used Stegall for HVAC units, electrical needs and plumbing issues and highly recommend them!  Just today I had a plumbing issue - was able to get a quick response time, and can’t express enough how awesome and thorough Brandon and Bobby were in resolving the problem and cleaning up afterwards.  And, the fees are so much more reasonable than what I’ve encountered in the past!

name: samuel mcdonald
text: We were very impressed with Joe's professionalism and integrity as he serviced our HVAC this morning. He did a wonderful job!

name: Tony Diliberto
text: Joe and Steven we on time and very profesh. Great company!

name: janet taylor
text: I just completely replaced my central heating/air system and duct work after many years long overdue, which was a task.  I shopped thoroughly and got 4 bids, Jeremiah's bid was best as well as the install was very satisfactory with experienced professional & courteous labor.  I greatly appreciated Jeremiah's drive and honesty to give the best job for the best price.  I also recommend Carrier Infinity unit with media filter and UV light.

name: BIZ 77
text: Had an issue with my drip pan being full and needed the drain unclogged so I contacted Stegall who sent Joe the same morning to get the issue resolved quickly.  Went ahead and signed up for the two visits a year deal because I was so impressed with the service we received.

name: Lisa Churchill
text: I called 4 different companies to help me with purchasing a new HVAC unit for my sunroom. No one could help with this purchase and install - all said that the crawl space was too small for a new unit. However, Stegall said, "Yes!" The team of Jo, Todd and Justin dismantled the existing unit piece by piece and fit the new unit in this tight space. It is anyways easier to say no but so glad that Stegall said YES! It works like a charm - thanks Stegall!

name: Caroline Langley
text: Joe Rider was the Technician that serviced our HVAC. He was quick to diagnose the issue, and he was very punctual. Would use again in the future!

name: Ron Inscho
text:
Friendly and helpful service.
Michael arrived within two hours of our urgent call and stayed until our problem was solved! The manager we worked with, Jerry,  was considerate of our plight and worked efficiently to help us get things resolved. This was one of those everything-goes-wrong days, and Stegall made it better.

name: Don Kraupa
text: Brandon did an awesome job and is very professional. He represents a great company, who must be proud to have him. Thank you Brandon.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words

name: Holly Nealey
text: Thanks Joe Rider for your great service! Always prompt and knowledgeable about services provided!

name: Tina Howse
text: Our A/C went out last night and Joe was here first thing this morning and had it fixed before we could even blink. He identified the problem, replaced the motor and now we're in the cool again. I can't thank Joe enough for helping us out in such a timely fashion. Thank you Joe!!!

name: kaytebugg016
text: It’s late June. My house was 85°. A technician came and went and my issue was resolved within 25 minutes. He was polite, fast, and very knowledgeable. I also live in a condo so my access to the HVAC and condenser units was not the most convenient. Overall I am 200% pleased. Would definitely call Stegall again.

name: Shana Moton
text: Stegall offered excellent customer service from being on time for our initial quote, to offering the best quote we received, to being able to install our new A/C the very next day (on a Saturday!!).  Andrew with Stegall offered service with a smile, was very knowledgeable, and was very kind and upfront with us the whole time.  We were very impressed with Stegall and recommend them to anyone needing to replace your home's A/C - it's going to be a hot summer!! But, thankfully, we'll be sitting cool inside our home :)

name: Karri Hensley
text: I called Stegall for a broken AC. Joe from Stegall was at my house 2hours later and expertly analyzed my system. He gave his recommendation and I followed it. A crew from (Todd and Brandon) Stegall showed up the next day to install a blower to properly match my existing heat pump. Todd and Brandon worked in withering heat and paid attention to the smallest details, not scratching or denting my floors, or walls.  The heat pump developed another small issue and Joe came back to inspect the over all system AND fixed the heat pump issue not charging me the callout fee. Joe, Todd and Brandon are excellent at their jobs and are very personable people. Stegall is a quality company. I would recommend them to you.

name: Darren Wells
text: Stegall came out and serviced my air conditioner. Justin was friendly and honest and explained everything he was doing and gave me great tips. I'm freezing and it's hot as hell outside! Thanks Stegall!!!

name: andrea egea
text: Mr Gilbert saved us tonight. Was very helpful and warned us of possible future problems. I am not totally useless when it comes to such things. Was the first place to call us back at a bad time of day. Great job!

name: Lauren Hall
text: We have used Stegall for years for yearly maintenance and other work. Technician Joe Rider has been wonderful, prompt and walks us through any issues!

name: Mortimer Calhoun
text: I'm very pleased with the services I have received with Stegall. Great company, great staff.

name: Terry Stinson
text:
The service man today was Joe Riley. He was, as is usual for Steagall, prompt and courteous and solved my problem quickly and professionally.  He went the extra mile for the filter I needed after he checked everything out.

I find Steagall and it’s employees to be knowledgeable and prompt and professional from the administrative side to the service side.

name: Julie Dana
text: Called in service order for my hot water heater and they came out the very next morning at 8AM!  The service guys were excellent and their attitude was very customer oriented and professional.  I will call Stegall again when I need services they provide.

name: Libby Langford
text:
Got home from work and the house was 80 degrees! Called another company and they couldn't get anyone out until late if any, and would charge an emergency fee. Called Stegall, and the guy was here in an hour, and had it fixed shortly afterward. Very professional and efficient, and the price was VERY resonable! They are definitely my "go to" people in the future.

By the way, I AM a real customer that had a real problem....

name: Carolyn Lantrip
text: I came home from work one day to find my air conditioning was not working properly and I called Stegall the next day.  Two technicians met me at my home on Smith Lake in Winston County AL that evening around 4:00 p.m.   They were very courteous and serviced the unit.  They explained exactly what part had gone bad, replaced it with a new one which they had on the van and had my air back on within the hour.  The charge for the work was more than fair and I will definitely use them again.

name: Jenifer White
text: Excellent service throughout the process! Everyone was punctual, professional, and competent. After a bad experience with another company, it's refreshing to see that there is a company that can meet expectations. Great job!

name: Zachariah Seanor
text: Joe stopped by today and made sure our unit was running efficiently for our big family reunion. Thanks Joe Rider for answering my questions and not judging our messy house 😄

name: Crystal Knezek
text: Our main A/C unit stopped blowing cold air. Jeremiah came out quickly and diagnosed and fixed the problem, after another company screwed it up and tried to make us think we needed a whole new unit. Jeremiah was straight forward, friendly, prompt and considerate, and above all, he was honest. Thanks!

name: Michael Heaven
text: Great company, repairs on our HVAC were reasonably priced.  The service professional that came to our house, Joe Rider, did a great job getting our system back in tip top shape and was prompt and courteos!

name: Daniel Richards
text: They came out to service my HVAC and did a fantastic job!!  Mr. Gilbert was very polite and took care of us.  I will definitely will be calling Stegall again for future issues.

name: Rena Miller
text: The technician was great.  On time and super friendly.   So far my experience with Stegall has been great.

name: Haley Dshae
text: I highly recommend Stegall mechanical for any plumbing, electrical, and hvac needs. Honest and reliable and all around great company.

name: Susie Brasher
text: We recently replaced one of our units using Stegall. They made sure we were purchasing the option that worked best with our budget. We were very happy with the customer service and overall experience. Thanks Stegall!

name: Rod Damon
text: I have used Stegall for at least 5 years. I have used them for HVAC maintenance, new hot water tank, and electrical work and have always had great service. I have a yearly maintenance contract with them to service my heat pump. They come out twice a year and I have had less unit problems since I've gone with them.

name: Jennifer Lerma
text: I knew that I needed a new heat pump as my current heat pump was 14 years old.  When I got home from church on Sunday and it was 80 degrees in my house, I knew I could put it off no longer.  I had a quote from another company but had recently learned about Stegall through a co-worker.  They came out to my house within a couple of hours of receiving my call, confirmed I needed a new system, gave me quotes and options, helped with me financing and installed my new system, all within 2 days.  They sold me a better system and a better price than what I had been quoted by another company.  Throughout the whole project, I was constantly being informed of what was going on and everyone was helpful, professional and nice. They answered all of my questions, no matter how inconsequential they may have been. Stegall is my company of choice and I will be happy to recommend them to all of my friends and family!

name: Brewer Family
text: Stegall has been our go-to for Plumbing, Electrical & HVAC. We have an older home, so the guys at Stegall help us give it a little TLC. Brandon Jones especially will go the extra mile! Thank you guys!

name: Jerry Baker
text: They came out to check on our HVAC and serviced it with an affordable price.

name: Abigail Cole
text: Stegall were very professional. Got great service. Got a new heat pump installed, it is working wonderful.

name: Jason Echols
text: My house AC unit stopped working. I am a plumber by trade but I have no idea when it comes to hvac type stuff. I call stegall and they came to my house and investigated the problem. I assumed I would be looking at a huge bill because I have had similar issues at a different residence, and Norrell charged me $600, 3 separate times over a number of yrs. so I figured it was going to be the same ole same ole. But was wrong!!!! The technician that came out explained everything he was looking for and what I needed to look for and do to prolong my AC unit. Turns out I was not doing maintenance for the unit that I was not aware of. He fixed it quickly and in no time the unit was running properly. My wife was super excited and happy......happy wife =happy life. Lol 😂

resp.text: Thanks Jason for the kind words,please let us know if we can help you in the future.

name: Sara Fondren
text: Be careful with these guys. I had one of them tell me my condenser was bad and had to be replaced for $5000 when it was actually just a fuse. Get a 2nd opinion or better yet just don't bother calling this place at all.

name: Ann D
text: Have used in the past for HVAC repair and maintenance and recently used again to install flood lights, fix a doorbell and a 2 way light switch.  They did a great job as always.

name: Anderson Jackson
text: Andrew did a very good job this morning, he ansered all my questions. I would recommend Stegall Heating and Air.

name: Niaj Nia
text: The tech came in to check my unit. He diagnosed it as a leak but never found a leak. In addition to charging me for a diagnostic fee, I was charged an additional $125.00 for a "leak check". Isn't the diagnostic a part of checking to see what is wrong with the unit ... including checking for leaks? I would not recommend this company AT ALL. They are ripoffs and I am taking them to court if my money is not returned. I will be contacting them on Monday about this matter.

text: Bought a service contract. They never called the number I gave them to set up appointments. When I need my ac fixed my contract is expired. I never received any service. Wouldn’t recommend a company that takes people’s money and doesn’t provide any services.

name: Jeremy R
text: Needed a heat pump and was impressed with how professional everyone was. I cancelled my other estimates and had a new heat pump the next day. Thanks.

text: Stay away! Came and LOOKED at my water heater. Could not fix it and sent me a $200 bill! ???? The company that actually made the repair charged me less than they did to LOOK at it. Garbage. DO NOT CALL.

name: Buddy Estes
text: very prompt, knew what he was doing and repaired on the spot!

name: Joe Allred
text:
My two HVAC units were due for annual spring service, and my commercial ice maker had stopped running .  Upon my request, Ken Speer called before his arrival, and promptly arrived on time. Very professional and friendly, Ken immediately began to perform the maintenance service due on my units.

I knew my upstairs heat pump system was in need of replacement, and Ken explained the problems with it, and recommended a replacement system that would be best suited for the space.

Ken determined the problem with my ice machine, installed the replacement part needed, and had my machine making ice, in less than an hour.

I mentioned to Ken, the water pressure in my house had never been sufficient, since I built my house in 2005, and he contacted a co-worker from Stegall's plumbing division, and upon his prompt arrival, they determined my pressure regulator needed replacing.  Stegall had the replacement part on their truck.  The new regulator was quickly installed, the pressure adjusted, and my water pressure problems were solved throughout my entire house, for the first time, since I built my house, 11 years ago.

I would highly recommend Stegall's services to anyone in need of HVAC, or plumbing service.  Ken Speer is a professional, knows his business, and promptly resolved 3 major issues within my home, and did so, in just a few hours.  I couldn't be happier with his customer service.  I give him an A+.

name: Marlin Headley
text: The technician, Joe, was courteous, efficient, and most importantly, arrived on time

name: Cindy Fletcher

name: Joe Allred
text:
My two HVAC units were due for annual spring service, and my commercial ice maker had stopped running .  Upon my request, Ken Speer called before his arrival, and promptly arrived on time. Very professional and friendly, Ken immediately began to perform the maintenance service due on my units.

I knew my upstairs heat pump system was in need of replacement, and Ken explained the problems with it, and recommended a replacement system that would be best suited for the space.

Ken determined the problem with my ice machine, installed the replacement part needed, and had my machine making ice, in less than an hour.

I mentioned to Ken, the water pressure in my house had never been sufficient, since I built my house in 2005, and he contacted a co-worker from Stegall's plumbing division, and upon his prompt arrival, they determined my pressure regulator needed replacing.  Stegall had the replacement part on their truck.  The new regulator was quickly installed, the pressure adjusted, and my water pressure problems were solved throughout my entire house, for the first time, since I built my house, 11 years ago.

I would highly recommend Stegall's services to anyone in need of HVAC, or plumbing service.  Ken Speer is a professional, knows his business, and promptly resolved 3 major issues within my home, and did so, in just a few hours.  I couldn't be happier with his customer service.  I give him an A+.

text: I had issues with my air. I called them they came right out and fixed the problem....

name: Ken Senes
text:
Update: Called SEARS again on May 24th to see if an earlier appointment could be made to install the part that had been ordered (I had called a week earlier to see if it would be possible to get someone to come out sooner than the almost 3 weeks I had previously been told that it would take to get someone to my house to put in the part). Well, to my surprise, this time I was told they could send out a serviceman the very next day (which they did). The repairman was very courteous and knowledgeable.....and the dryer has now been repaired.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Did not show up for first service call. Said truck broke down but we never received a call. Sears said they texted us...but upon further investigation, Sears said they transposed our telephone #, so who knows who received the message that said they weren't going to show up. Wasted one day waiting for repair man. Then after almost 2 weeks later, a repairman finally shows up. He was nice enough and seemed to know what he was doing. Said that a part would need to be ordered. Okay, fair enough. Part came in almost two weeks later; however, was told it will be almost another 3 weeks before Sears can send someone out to install the part. Customer service??? I don't think so. Bottom line: Almost 7 weeks without a dryer that's under Sear's Home Warranty program is a very POOR indicator of this company's ability to honor their agreement. Still waiting for June 9th to get here. Hope they show up. Signed, "Not holding my breath."

resp.text: Thank you, Ken Senes, for taking the time to provide us with your rating and review. We are sorry to hear you have not had a good experience with us. If you would please message us with the name, address, and phone number that is associated with this issue to our Sears Home Services Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/SearsHomeServices/, we will be able to see how we can help out. Please reference this review in your message, thank you

resp.text: Thank you Johnny N.for your 5-star rating! We thank you for your business and look forward to serving you again in the future.

name: Julie Lovoy
text: MY REFRIGERATOR IS STILL NOT WORKING!!!!!!! THE REPAIR DID NOT WORK. THE TECH HAS PUT IN SEVERAL REQUESTS FOR THIS MODEL TO BE REPLACED WHICH HAVE ALL BEEN IGNORED.  I HAVE CALLED 2 TIMES ONLY TO BE ON HOLD FOR 2 PLUS HOURS WHICH IS OUTRAGEOUS AND EACH TIME I REACHED A REAL PERSON I WAS CUT OFF!!!!!!!  WHAT HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE YOU HAVE.  YOU OBVIOUSLY DON'T VALUE YOUR CUSTOMERS AT ALL.  NOW I AM STUCK WITH A BROKEN BOTTOM FREEZER/REFRIGERATOR WHICH IS BROKEN AND TAKING UP SPACE.  I SHOULD HAVE NEVER PURCHASED THIS FROM SEARS.

name: Adam Pest
text: Sears came to my home and did a diagnostic test on my washing machine, then said they needed to order a part. Almost a month later after not hearing from them, I received an email saying that my order has been cancelled and that my request had been completed. After calling the help line, they told me that everything was done and that my washer had been fixed, but none of that happened. They took our check for the part, cashed it, then closed our ticket. No one during this process was rude to me in any way, but none of them were helpful in any way. I am absolutely appalled with Sear, and will not be using any of their services ever again because of this.

name: Iman Dayarian
text: I wish I could give 0 stars! My refrigerator is not working. The first available appointment was in 2 weeks, which I booked. The technician came and ran a diagnostic check and told me he needed to order parts. Then I didn't hear back anything. After 3 days, I called and they told me the service was canceled and I have to schedule another one and the next available appointment is in 3 weeks. Who does business like this? I'm simply speechless!

name: Barbara Willis
text: Appointment time of 8 to 5pm is not realistic. Was sent text “ service repair person was on the way” received this at 1245 pm and repair tech showed up at 445pm.

name: David Williamson
text:
Excellent service.
Tech arrived early. Was professional courteous. Explained exactly what he was doing. Explained warranty options. Accepted a 20% off coupon I printed online. Explained payment options. I was very pleased with the entire experience

name: Gene Raburn
text: The repair was done quickly and efficiently on the exact day of the appointment.  It took two trips to actually assess the problem, get the proper part delivered, and the final repair completed.  That seems to be the norm for appliances with such technologically advanced systems to trouble shoot.  Thank you for sending such a well trained and first class technician.

name: Thomas Prewitt
text: The repair went good but it shouldn't take 8 days for a repair person to come out. That is very inconvenient when you have a family of 4 or a if it's just you. I would DEFINITELY hope in the near future you all could be faster in your repair services.

name: Eugene Dirks
text: Technician was nice and courteous. He fixed one problem and ran a diagnostic check and said everything checked out ok but the washer does not spin.

name: Leigh Ann Colvin
text: The Sears technician, Danny was super. The technician completed diagnosis of problem with my front load washer and replaced part. He explained appliance cleaning service offered by Sears. The technician removed front panel of dryer and cleaned large amount of lint from inside. The build up of lint could cause a fire. He also removed back panel of refrigerator and vacuum coils. I was very impressed with technician knowledge about my appliances  and the cleaning service.

name: Kay Dockery
text: It has been almost a month and my washer is still not working!!! Still have not got the part to do the repair.  They say is will be at least another week. This is crazy!!! No on has that many clothes to go that long without a washer.  What is bad, no one seems to care!!!   Sears service has really went down.  I have kept service contracts for over 25 years and it is at its lowest point now!! I have been a loyal customer up to this point.  I think I will try Lowes when my contracts  run out if service does not improve!!! I have contract on everything is my house.

name: spcljac07
text: Set an appointment 2 weeks ago. The repair window was 8am-5pm at 2:41 pm the tech calls to tell me he will be here are 6 pm. At 4:50pm he calls back to say that he will not make it and :maybe " he can come tomorrow.  I call the 877 repairs line to complain about the wasted 9 hour day and I find out the tech, put in the system that he came to the house and no one was home. They can reschedule me for an appointment in 10 days.  Sears wonders why their business is dying. I have done my last business with Sears

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your review. We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced. We understand your frustration and know your time is important. If you would like us to look into this situation further, please email us at SHSSocialcare830@searshc.com with you name, address, and phone number associated with your account. Thank you.  ^AM

name: Sebastian Holcomb
text: I always love shopping here. From the amazing selection of home appliances to the automotive department, Sears is one of the best one-stop shops for everything you need.

name: Robert Morris
text:
Randall the repairman was professional and quick.
In and out within the hour.
Overall good experience.
I would recommend Sears Repair Online Booking to others.
RM

name: Angela Blake
text: Very polite employee..........my washer could only be temporarily fixed, so he fixed it enough so I could do laundry until I can get another washer and only charged me half of the service charge......I have always had a good experience with Sears Appliance Repair!!!!!

name: Virginia Wilson
text: My experience with the technician went well,he explained and showed me  the correct way to turn on the washer to avoid anymore problems.He was very nice and pleasant to talk to and may ai add,the previous technician in January were very nice too,he just forgot to show me how to operate the washer without causing the same problem.I wanted to add that because I didn't get a chance to fill out a survey for his service..Thank You

name: Deborah Crocker
text: The repair was done quickly and the service man was knowledgable about the issue. I have been very happy with their service.

name: Fox101
text: I miss Sears they had a great selection of tools and appliances.

name: jsejse23
text: Bad experience. Not able to fix my washing machine. The first repair person diagnosed a problem and ordered a part to fix the clutch. When the part came in, a 2nd group of repairmen came to the house. The washer was working, but could only handle light loads when the repairmen came to the house to "fix" the issue and install the new part. After the repairmen installed the new part, the washer will not work at all. At the end of the 2nd service call, I was told that the washer is broken, not fixable, and I will need to buy a new washer. Machine went from working, but only able to run small loads to completely broken. Very unsatisfied.

name: Mike Dickson
text: No one came to repair the washer. Now they have rescheduled it for Nov 16. Another 3 weeks without a washing machine!

name: Mike Oakley
text: Sears has gone terribly downhill in customer response. I say Customer response becuase the Customer Service reps, based in Arizone, were all helpful but there was no "follow-up" to the conversation. Over the course of 20+ days, I was asked the same questions repeatedly and given different "case numbers," none of which helped concerning a dishwasher with warranty. I was told, at one point, that there were no service calls in my area in the next month! There was no issue SELLING the appliance so why is there an issue in upholding a promise?  What DID help was when I went on Social Media and complained and many others complained about Sears. I got a message within a day. When a service rep finally came, after more than a month for a dishwashwer UNDER WARRANTY, he was fairly good.

resp.text: Mike, we regret to hear that you went through so much trouble with your dishwasher issues; however, we are happy to hear that you were able to find assistance with our Social Media team! Please do not hesitate to reach back out to us on the social channels if you need further assistance!

name: Gary Bolen
text:
Here is Sears asking for a " How did I like the service" comment when the  service hasn't been done. My mower's drive belt broke.  And it was time for the annual servicing. So I called and everything went well.  Parts ordered, service time arranged, Life was good. Two weeks later, no parts, no service call.  When I called back to check, the number I was given was not a correct number.  I had to call four times to the service number.  The first time I was transferred four times to get to the correct division for my service contract on my mower.  The fourth person couldn't help me and transferred me back to the third person and they 'dropped' the call.  Two hours 18 minutes... no, I did not call back that day.  Finally got through to the proper division for the mower service contract.  Got the service time set up with my complaint and requested service ordered.

The serviceman arrives and I tell him what I had asked for and he says he was only told about the broken belt.  No new blades, no new cut grass shield, and NO service.  He starts to replace the belt and I quickly saw he did not have the correct belt.  He had been given the belt that turns the blades, not the drive belt.

So off to the hardware store to get the correct belt.  Once he gets back, the drive belt repair was completed quickly.  Two days later, a different service tech comes by to look at the mower to get the numbers to order the shield.   He promises me that he will put in the request for the annual service.  A week later, someone comes out to my house and installs the shield on the mower,  No service, no new blades.  My son and I go get some new blades and put them on ourselves.  At least I can cut grass now.

STILL WAITING ON THE SERVICE.  I would take this back to Sears, but.....

name: Jacque Sherbak
text: Prompt, pleasant and assessed the problem immediately.  He ordered the part and installed it within a week.  Our beeping refrigerator was silent once again.  Very reasonable time.  We found it very helpful that Sears is now sending parts to the repair shops instead of customer homes.  This allows repair to contact us with a time in mind.  Another improvement is Sears is using local repair businesses which makes service time more convenient and faster for all. Much better!

name: Glen Zachreson
text: Received a completed status email on a work order which was not fixed. Need more detail information to the reason why the work order was closed. Unable to get the status online.

name: charlie whatley
text: Sears repair came out as scheduled, diagnosed the unit not cooling properly both freezer and refrigerator. Technician was very knowledgeable and professional. Job was completed by servicing the compressor and recharging and checking for leaks. Paid the service fee of about $145. The freezer came to life and is freezing but the refrigeration dept. only gets down ranging from 44-55 degrees. We are very disappointed as we installed a new compressor via Sears Appliance Repair in October of 2019. The most recent tech did not check any other components except the compressor. Any possibility of a tech coming out to check other components of our unit? Another disappointed customer!!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention, charlie. We hate to see that you have had this kind of experience and would love the opportunity to take a look to see how we can help out. If you would please email the name, address, and phone number that is associated with the service order to our Sears Home Services Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/SearsHomeServices/, we will be able to see how we can help out. We appreciate your business and look forward to assisting you with this matter.

name: Sheree “Gigi” Thornton
text: The Mechanic was very personable and knowledgeable and had us up and running again in no time. My only complaint was it took so long to get an appointment...almost 2 weeks out from the day I called. Other than that, I was very pleased with the actual work and the mechanic who performed it.

name: Bara Designs
text: I have maintained a Sears Home Warranty on a few of my appliances for several years now, and I can truly say that it has more than paid for itself!  Unfortunately they just don't make things like they used too!  The folks that work for Sears are professional, courteous, thorough, and prompt!  Recently when my refridgerator was accumulating condensation and causing the metal shelving brackets to rust, they first told me that rust was not covered, however after further investigating they discovered the insulation had failed and are providing me with a full replacement!  I highly recommend Sears and their home maintenance agreements.

name: Nancy Reba
text: Courteous and efficient.  Will only buy appliances, etc. at Sears because of the wonderful service.

name: Sarah Creech
text: Sears Buyer Beware:  I am a senior and have been a loyal Sears’s customer for over 50 years but am very sad to say, I will never utilize Sears products or their service ever again and I will warn everyone I know to beware.   Sears furnished my homes in Chicago, Bethlehem, PA and in Montgomery, AL.  Sears has been my standby for over 50 years and it was an institution I really believed in.   The horrible, inexcusable way I have been treated by Sears in Daphne, AL for the past two months is unforgivable. I was told that I would be receiving a refund from 4 different Sears’s people.  I called Sears each time check was promised and not received.  I was told that confirmation would be sent via email very shortly.  Emails never came.   The fourth time (after 2 months) the Sears person I called said they had decided not to give me a refund.  So, I am going to the Better Business Bureau.  Sears may be going out of business, but they could hurt a lot of people in the meantime.  It took almost two months of contacting Sears Customer Service before I got to this point.   My dryer was old, and the refund promised wasn’t that much.   My refund is no longer the point.  After reading all of the numerous complaints by Sears customers, in addition to what I experienced first-hand, something needs to be done to protect others.

name: Keith & Suzanne Douglas
text:
Washing Machine still don't work since May 20, 2017 started pursuing Repairs.
It is now July 24, 2017
I purchased protection agreement in good faith.
They offered me $50.00 rewards.
That is not the equivalent to purchase price of washing machine or purchase agreement plan.
I only want it to work or a replacement washing machine that works.
It worked a little before service took place just made a loud noise.

name: Nelson Russell
text:
My complaint is not with the workmanship.  The technician was very professional and proficient; however, when he tech arrived, I was advised that some parts were not covered by the maintenance agreement.  I should have been told this on the first trip when the grill was inspected and the parts were ordered.  Cost was reasonable, but totally unexpected.
While we're at it, I also had a maintenance agreement on some yard equipment, but did not renew because I now have to drive 50 miles to take them to an authorized sears repair shop.  You would think that in a city the size of Mobile AL that Sears would have a local repair facility.  The days of getting service from companies who appreciate the customer is over.  Sad state of affairs.

name: Clay Davidson
text:
Technician was pleasant and fixed my fridge without any issues. His performance is the direct reason I purchased a home warranty from sears.

Good experience. Definitely recommend.

name: Renee Jones
text:
Refrigerator not working since 1/28. We had to throw all our food out. Customer service scheduled an appointment for  today 8 am - 12 pm.
Appliance repair company that handles repairs for Sears rescheduled our appointment for  Friday morning.  They dont do repairs in Georgia on Tuesday,  only Alabama. Sears assured us they were coming out. They NEVER came. Called customer service,  call went to the Philippines! They were NO help at all! Dont waste your money on the Master Protection Plan. It gets you promises of food reimbursement IF the technician says the there is no way the food would have been edible if we left it in there.
The entire refrigerator is HOT on the inside like it's not  plugged up.  Dont ask for a Supervisor to call either. They won't.  Never buying anything from them again.

resp.text: We hate to see that you have had this kind of experience and would love the opportunity to take a look to see how we can help get things moving in the right direction. If you would please email the name, address, and phone number associated with the order to SHSSocialcare@searshc.com and we will be able to see how we can help out. We appreciate your business and look forward to assisting you with this matter

name: Janet Boukal
text: The technician arrived on time and was very knowledgeable and helpful. The repair was done in less than 30 minutes and I am very satisfied. I have already recommended Sears to another family member.

name: Joan Lomax
text: My Friend Wiliams wife said he was the same guy that repaired it before and he knew right away what was wrong, please with service to get it fixed

name: Terry Rickell
text: Very satisfied with the Appliance Repair Tech that came out for our Maintenance Check and minor repair. He was extremely helpful and knowledgable about the appliance.

name: amlight1
text: Serviceman thought on a previous call that the temperature sensors needed to be replaced. He ordered 2. Said that when he came back he would olhm them to make sure they were accurate.  When he came back he immediately open the packages and asked me to disconnect the power to the oven. I did and he immediately replace the sensors not checking them for accuracy. Within 10 minutes he told me to turn the power back on. Packed up his tools and said that should take care of it. I ask him if he was not going to put his temperature sensor in and check the temperature and this was his answer. " well you will just have to cook in it" and left.  Problem was not solved,  the oven was still cooking at 60° hotter than the temperature setting.

name: Sonny Weeks
text: Following two repairmen visits to my home to repair an ice maker in my Kenmore refrigerator, my ice maker is still not working. I am now waiting almost one month for another appointment to have someone come out to my home for the third time.  At this time my experience with Sears repair is very poor.  I am very disappointed in my experience and do not see customer service as a tool that Sears repair service can advertise.  When my appointment is given, each time I am told they will be at my home between 8 am and 5 pm.  For a family where everyone works, this is certainly not convenient.  If my ice maker had been repaired this may have been more tolerable.  I was told by the last rep that the 90 day repair guarantee began at the time of the first repair appointment. That just adds fat to the fire in my lack of confidence in your services.

name: Mike Lehan
text: Technician arrived on time. He did a good job of annealing the issue and repaired the mower completely. I was very satisfied with the repair and the technician.

name: ron Joyner
text: The repairs and service were outstanding.The tech ( Malcolm)that came to our home was very friendly and professional. Repairs were quick with no unusual complications. Extremely pleased.

name: Tammy Johnson
text:
Repairs to my washer were preformed by a knowledgeable and very courteous tech.
Very pleased with this service and recommend it highly....
They also have a great home warranty plan as well👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍👍

name: Rosemary Messer Fender
text: This was my yearly check up just to make sure that the dishwasher and freezer are in good working order. The service rep. was knowledgable on both.

name: Wendy Sullivan
text: Rinaldo was engaging polite and knowledgeable. He repaired my refrigerator in a short time. I am completely happy with the result.

name: Betty Hoyle
text: He did a great job.  He knew what to fix when he looked the  mower over, I was very happy with his services.

name: Raymond Hare
text: Tech was the best! He diagnosed the problem and ordered the part to fix it for me. He listened to my concerns and was helpful in every way possible.

name: John Blount
text: Repair technician did a good job once they arrived. It took close to 2 weeks to get the service scheduled.

name: Shelby Rhodes
text: Washer repair technician was great,polite, knowledgeable,fixed prob,but Sears charged 79$ diagnostic fee,plus 45$ labor plus parts,I called number on receipt,the girl I spoke with was nice,said I would receive a 50 $ gift card by e mail...,.Still looking.......

name: Sharon McCaskill
text:
My ice maker was not fixed.  This was the 5th time we have called fro repair on it and it is not ever fixed. Still leaking water from the ice dispenser down the front of the fridge

Another service man came out this week and caulked the ice maker again.  It is still leaking from the ice maker inside the refridgerater and probably will begin leaking again from the dispenser again. NOT FIXED ...AGAIN.  IT SEEMS THEY CAN'T FIX IT.

Again my ice maker and dispenser are leaking about 1/4 cup each time I get ice and it is leaking and forming ice cycles from outside the ice bucket. Still the same. It is sad to have to go through this when you need your refrigerator repaired especially when it began when you got it home and as much as the price was that I paid!

Still leaking again.  The last repair man installed a new fan or did something to the fan. It helped a short while. Then started again.  This time the repair man did something else in the ice compartment.  It is better for now but just waiting to see if it fixed it this time.  We will see.

name: Brittany Miller
text: A complete waste of money--- had to call our  electrician---- technicians at our home less than 5 minutes but waited the entire day  when originally  tole 0800-1200 appt. Technicians arrived after 1400. Do not plan to use sears for anything in the future. this one star is generous. Sears needs to  get rid of the outsourced customer service in the third world countries--- they simply  do not care( sears must not either) and are completely  incompetent !!!!!

name: Melissa Duplesis
text: It as always is great Cody was very nice and helpful and I would like to have him and him only to do all of my things in the future. You have a great guy hang on to him.

name: Barbara Robinson
text: Great service--Very polite young serviceman--Thank you!

name: Paul Dowsey
text: The Lady , Althea,  was on time, did a superb job, corrected my mower problem and was most pleasant.  Thank you Sears.  Paul Dowsey

name: Joyce Langley
text: The technician arrived over an hour past the scheduled time and had not advised me of the expected delay until over 30 minutes past the arrival window. More importantly, the dryer was not fixed properly. The replaced belt came off when attempting to dry the first load. I contacted the technician immediately, but he refused to return. I was required to schedule another appointment through Sears - first available 6 days later- and learned that he actually had assumed the first repair would probably not hold. He was also late for this appointment but did contact me just shortly past the window for arrival. It was properly repaired this time, but I found the exhaust vent hose no longer attached securely. A voicemail message to him within 15 minutes of his leaving was ignored and I finally had to have someone else repair it. This was a very unpleasant repair experience!

name: Sherry Scarbrough
text: I hope after about the 10th time (I've lost count), that Titus has found the problem of my 'sometimes leaking' dishwasher. (Plugs omitted in the sides of dishwasher).   This has been an ordeal that has left a bad taste in my mouth for Sears repair.  Each service man has been nice, they just could NOT find the problem  .....hence.....I've wasted many days as 'lady- -in-waiting.'

name: Carol Oglesby
text: Fast & efficient. Washer works great. Thank you.

name: Ron Maxime

I had to wait a week for a service technician to come out to tell me what is wrong with it and now it has been over a week awaiting the part to arrive. All the while I am without a $2000 dollar refrigerator. Now I see why sears will soon go the way of GE.

text:
WITHOUT REFRIG for the long hot summer was too much. Issue resolved with, appliance not repairable. Ok!  But to have customer  continue wait for delivery( due to storm in JACKSONVILLE,FL) WHERE wearhouse is .THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. CUSTOMER/I SHOULD NOT have had to continue to wait.  ARE THERE NOT OTHER SEARS WAREHOUSE
AVAILABLE? SUCH AS In ALABAMA.  HINT: IF YOU VALUE YOUR CUSTOMER ; SATISFACTION IS THE KEYS.  Need help with loss food. Had to purchase APT SZ REFRIG WITH MY POINTS AND CASH...NOT GOOD SERVICE. DISSATISFIED.  .....

name: James Ryan Arwood (Ryan)

name: George Lansky

name: Kevin Fairclough
text: ACS, INC replaced a gas pack for me. The installation was on time and the installation crew was efficient, competent and careful. In contrast to some other HVAC companies, the owner is very easy to contact.

name: Joe
text: Over the last eleven years, Robert Akins and ACS has provided nothing but high-quality, professional, and responsive service.  When one of my two HVACs went out in my new home, I called the company that installed it and they said the earliest they could come was three days.  When I called ACS, they were there the next morning.  I have been calling on ACS ever since.  During a heat wave, after Robert explained he would have to charge overtime, ACS fixed my HVAC on a Sunday morning.  Whenever ACS was at my house to fix my HVAC, after analyzing the problem, they were clear on what needed to be done,  how long it would take to fix it, how much it would cost, and why.  If necessary, they also provided a variety of payment options so I could choose what best met my situation.  So when one of my two HVACs needed to be replaced, ACS was one of two companies I called for an estimate.  While the other estimate was flowered with discounts for various reasons, the ACS estimate was clear, concise, and competetive.  Robert Akins spent a lot of time explaining options and whether they were worth the expense.  The unit ACS proposed has a lifetime condenser replacement warranty if the compressor ever fails.  An option ACS had that the other did not was a ten year warranty on the labor for warrantied repairs.  Finally, when the competitor said it would take at least a week for the replacement HVAC to come in, ACS had my new unit installed the next day on December 22, the week of Christmas!  So whether you are looking to replace your current HVAC unit or just repair the one you have, I highly recommend Robert Akins and ACS.  They have always been there when I needed them and taken care of the problem efficiently and professionally.

name: FRED RICHARDSON
text: Great customer service. Robert and his technical employees are top notch. He is fair and honest and always does what is best for the customer.

name: Emily of Earth
text: They were able to come to my house the same day that I called! My technician was very knowledgeable and friendly.

name: William Hastie
text: ACS responded in a reasonable time.  A capacitor was replaced.  The wholesale cost of the capacitor is under $30.  I was charge $130 for the capacitor plus labor to replace it.  Total charge $245.  So, if you do not mind a 300+% markup on material, then you can select ACS.  I will go elsewhere.

resp.text:
It is always a travesty for ACS, Inc. to have an unsatisfied customer and we do all that we can to help our customers have a good experience with us and continue a long term service relationship.  Unfortunately, occasionally, due to whatever reasons whether by our fault or other circumstances, a customer is dissatisfied.  In this case we did not learn of Mr. Hastie's dissatisfaction until he posted a negative review.  There was no phone call, no inquiry, no attempt to communicate or seek a resolution to his complaint, just a negative review.
After speaking to the technician and reviewing the statements associated with this service I found the following facts to be true:

Mr Hastie called to report his house was hot and his air conditioning was not working late in the afternoon.  I diverted a technician to his house after 4:30 pm to help him so that hopefully he would not have to go through another hot night in his house.  (We go on overtime at 5:00 pm).  The technician found the primary problem and responded by installing a part from his truck which was close to what was required but not the correct spec.  The temporary fix allowed the unit to run and cool the house overnight providing immediate relief for Mr. Hastie.  The technician did not charge for the overtime.

The part required was an odd spec which the technicians and many of our professional vendors do not carry locally (often an order Item).  The next day our technician searched among our vendors until he found a part locally.  He returned to the Hastie residence and exchanged the temporary part for the correct one.  Our technician also inspected the refrigerant charge and found a need to add some refrigerant to achieve the correct cooling specs per his instruments upon this return visit.

Moreover, our technician did not charge Mr. Hastie for the procurement or travel time required to serve his needs.  For the more than 3 hours time involved working exclusively on Mr. Hastie's behalf our technician charge him only for a service call and 1 hour labor.  As far as the cost of the part:  yes we, like most service operations who provide a responsive service, charge a markup on parts.  We do not attempt to compete with internet pricing.  Our pricing structure reflects the convenience of having the part, our vendors supporting us to have a part available, and the network which guarantees and supports the quick response business.

Otherwise, a client is free to diagnose his own problem, order his parts online and wait in the heat until the part arrives (hoping he did not make a mistake or that a wrong part was shipped.)

In conclusion:  Our technician followed pricing guidelines which have been satisfactory for our extensive client base for more than 40 years.  He waived labor costs in the hopes of establishing Mr. Hastie as a long term satisfied customer.  Mr. Hastie indicated to the technician that he was satisfied and grateful for the prompt service and relief from the heat.

Had Mr. Hastie called to inquire about the charges, we could have explained to him and even offered him a coupon if he was still not happy.  Personally, I see this negative review as simply malicious with the intent of harming our otherwise excellent review status and without any interest in understanding or seeking a resolution with ACS, Inc.

Mr Josh Nelson was excellent!  I don’t ever leave reviews but this gentleman was knowledgeable, courteous, and was concerned with walking on my rugs etc. etc.  He also explained my thermostat to me and all the settings again and never made me feel like a question that I was asking was silly.
I will continue calling AC whenever I have a problem and hopefully Josh Nelson will be the man that comes out.   Thank you!!!!!!!!

name: Nathan
text: Called to get information on a repair. Instead all I received was a smart aleck and demeaning response followed with profanity. Extremely unprofessional. If someone speaks this way towards potential business, I highly question their ethical standards in performing a repair. AVOID.

resp.text:
I remember this caller.  Nathan called and began asking me vague questions about what was wrong with his heating system.  I told him that it sounded like we needed to send a tech out for diagnostics.  He asked me what the charge would be and I told him the minimum cost of a service call and labor for a call out.  He then asked me an unusual question for our industry.  He asked me why we charged for diagnostics.  From having dealt with the public for 40 years I understood that he was not familiar with how service companies operate.  I proceeded to explain to him why a company had to charge to send a tech to a remote location, time, equipment cost, travel, insurance, education and training, overhead and all of the costs associated with a working company.  I explained that the tech, for instance, had to be paid from the moment he clocked in which included the driving time to a residence and back, hence the service call.  Nathan took offense at the explanation and told me that he did not need a "lecture".  I asked him then why he asked such a question if he did not expect or want a comprehensive answer, to which he abruptly hung up the phone. There was no profanity.  Moments later this negative review arrived in my email.

Part of the service we provide is educational.  We are a very empirical and logic based company.  We deal with applied science.  When a question is asked we do our best to answer it thoroughly.  I often help clients solve heating and air conditioning issues over the phone at no charge when able.  I have recently successfully instructed non technical house wives in restoring their heat over the phone. My communication skills are very good.  In this circumstance it was very important that the potential client understood the charges and per his questions why there were charges.  If the customer does not understand that he will be charged for a visit and that he has an obligation to pay, or if he protests the value of the service prior to a visit by a tech, then we cannot send a tech to his residence.

Unfortunately, part of the job of dealing with the general public is to screen the potential client to make sure that the interaction with the company and the technician is successful and satisfactory for both parties.  We will not send a technician into a contentious situation.  We would have liked to have helped Nathan but the initial phone interaction and the "hang up" indicated that the interaction would not be successful.

name: Chris Robinson
text: It was honestly a really great experience from start to finish. My wife met with Cason and we went into wanting multiple options which i thought were all fairly presented and well explained without any pressure of which to go with. I have a close friend who worked for many years for both Trane and Carrier with many of the dealers throughout Birmingham. He gave me a list of 3 companies he would have out to his home personally. Skelton was one of those, another company that i liked very much, and then one we didnt have a great experience on the quote with. Between Skelton and the other competitor, although Skeltons price was higher we were sold by the labor warranty and some of the other written guarantees, along with the rec from our friend. Installation - I believe it was Mark, my wife was the one on site - went way better than i could have imagined. We arranged last minute to have the unit moved to a new location. All of the work was very well done. I had an idea in my head of what "the aftermath" should have looked like and the equipment involved in the move and all that, and i probably would have been satisfied with a lot less. Its obviously a lot of money for most families, so I was bound to have some mix of buyers remorse and hesitation about whether or not we'd gone with the right people However, when i got home and saw the quality of the work, how neatly and efficiently and professionally everything was done, i immediately felt entirely confident in our decision and knew we had some true professionals out at the house. I think its the first time in my life ive spent that much money on something and dont have any regrets or second guessing about who we chose to spend it with. Kudos to both Cason and Mark's teams. Thanks yall!

name: Louis Dina
text: Skelton's Heating, Cooling and Refrigeration just installed a new AC, furnace and air handler in our upstairs attic (difficult job getting it all in an our up a set up rickety pull-down stairs). They also use Trane equipment which is good quality and highly rated. Their prices were competitive and they did great work. I'm hard to impress, but they impressed me. Thanks for the great job. Oh yeah, 10 year warranty on parts and labor is standard if you pay cash.

text: Very happy with Skelton’s. They came out today and installed a new 3 unit. They were very polite and very helpful. I would highly recommend them to anyone. They have one happy customer 😂😂

text:
I don’t write reviews but these guys are really professional. On time; nice tight work; the installers took pride in their work & cleaned up afterward. Salesman was clear, precise & brief - no wasted time “up-selling”. We got what we needed & got it installed quickly - less than 3 hours.

I was surprisingly pleased (as I am usually cynical about such endeavors).

resp.text: Mr. Widener, thank you for the excellent review. We are pleased to know that you had a great experience using Skelton's for your HVAC install!

name: Patrick McDonald
text: I had scheduled an estimate on Wednesday, June 10 8-9 a.m. Estimator showed up on Thursday, 8 a.m. to perform the estimate. Estimate was done without measuring, or even going under the house. I have zero confidence that the estimate is accurate; I felt like the estimator was simply seeing how much he could get out of me. No detail on the estimate i received. Just got the total dollar figure that seems about 3x higher than it should be. With the time he spent, he really pulled the numbers out of his hat (or some other place).

resp.text: Thank you Patrick for your feedback. We are very sorry that your recent experience was not a pleasant one. We strive to provide great service and when we fall short of this we try to do everything we can to resolve the issue. Again, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and hope you will give us another chance to make things right. Please give us a call at 205-991-5878 and ask for Chad.

name: Louis Dina
text: My 15 year old AC unit was recharged about 5 weeks ago. When it stopped working again, I assumed all the Freon leaked out again and that it needed replacement. I asked Skelton’s to give a quote on a replacement unit. Their technician was very thorough and discovered a bad switch and capacitor, which he replaced on the spot. He checked our Freon levels and said they were still perfect. His extra effort and honesty saved us from having to buy a new unit at this time, even though he could have easily convinced me we needed a new unit. (Two other companies also provided quotes on new units, but neither of them discovered the underlying issue.) Honesty and integrity, and a desire to serve the customer’s best interests, are important to me. Skelton’s proved it by their actions. When it is time for a replacement AC system, I’ll call Skelton’s.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience! We appreciate the review and your business.

name: Jay Miller
text:
My 94 year old Dad's AC system went out on a Thursday afternoon in rural Alabama with the heat index well over 100. Justin promptly called me back and was out to check the system before the end of business that same day. The entire system had to be replaced so it couldnt be resolved that day. Justin lined up Wes and his crew so that they could begin the replacement first thing once the system was delivered. I was told everything would be good to go by 1pm. My Dad and I arrived at 12pm and Wes told me all they needed was access to the thermostat and they would be finished. This group understood the critical situation my Dad was in and went above and beyond to make sure his unit was installed and operating ASAP.
Thank you so much guys...you'll never know how much it meant to my Dad to get back to his home.

name: Doug Tilt
text:
I remodeled a room in my lake house which required repositioning the main intake vent from a vertical in -wall position to an in-floor register.  Brian Skelton , company owner, came out the day after my call, evaluated the job and provided a best guess estimate for the proposed task
The following day a team of two technicians  arrived at 0800 , as agreed. Within 4 hours the old vent box was removed, a new floor frame between the joists was constructed, a new box placed and large duct connected to the existing AC/ Heating unit and new ,sturdy floor grate placed( and thermostat repositioned)

The Skelton team were most professional and efficient.  The job site was completely cleaned and everything double checked to be sure everything was done to my satisfaction and functioning well. An immediate follow up call to me by company owner was appreciated.

The total cost was $960.00 based on labor and materials , which was as expected per initial estimate

My five star rating was completely deserved based on professionalism, punctuality, job done, and charge. I definitely recommend this company and will use them again.

Doug Tilt

text:
First of all, the technician showed up 2.5 hours late to refill the Freon in our AC unit. But being late was only the start of it.   We discussed the possibility of having a full unit replacement because he said if the Freon kept running out then that meant it was probably time to replace the unit. So with that said, we weren’t planning to spend a ton of money on Freon since doing that repeatedly meant there was a problem.  He then continued to agree he would fill only 4lbs of Freon but instead filled It with 8.5 lbs without consent,  skyrocketing our bill.   Let’s just say they will not be the ones replacing my Air Conditioning unit when that time inevitably comes.

All being said, I would never recommend this company.  Despicable display of business ethics.

resp.text:

name: sheila fulkerson
text: when I first called Tiger Heating and Air on Aug 9th, I was pretty pleased with the quick service that I received from this company. But after my experience with them over a new problem I am very disappointed. I wouldn't refer them to a dog house if it needed to be cooled down. My a/c unit stopped working Aug 29th, I called the owner and he was suppose to get back to me within an hour. I called his phone atleast fifty times from my phone and numerous times from my husband and unpublished as well. I finally get in touch with him today and he schedules the appointment for noon- 1pm my time (which is 11a-12p their time). I am sitting here in a hot house waiting on the a/c man... it's almost one pm my time and he calls me just before and tells me that he isn't coming out today I needed to call the warranty company and have them schedule someone else to come out. there are plenty of contractors in Phenix City that could come out today (did he call them and ask to see, hell no), he tells me that there is no way that he can come out he has an emergency at the hospital. that is understandable but why can't you send someone other than yourself to check my unit? He tells me that it isn't that hot outside that it could wait till Monday. This man knows that I have seven month old child as well as a four year old and he has the balls to tell me that it can wait because it isn't hot? The next time my baby throws up on me I will make sure I call him so she can do it to him. she can't be in the heat she has too many problems for it and he is not worth the time of day or the money you will spend. CALL SOMEONE BETTER, PLEASE!!!

name: Carmen Gooden
text:
Called the company because ac unit fan wasn’t blowing. When the owner got out of his truck he was already discussing a new ac unit. Kept stating unit old r22 Freon is not made anymore and is $150+ per lb. After I told him we weren’t interested in a $7600 unit he was done talking. Asked how much would it be to fix the fan since he stated fan motor was no good. He said $700+ and he’ll have to take it off to send to shop. Next day I call another company. They replaced the capacitor and fan started back working. Changed out the hard start because it was no good. Now the ac unit is working great!

Update:
Office manager Alica reach out regarding the issue I had with the service I received. She was very pleasant, thoughtful, and very understanding. She went above and beyond to resolve the issue. I’m happy with the outcome! Thank you Alica

text: I called them they were very polite and courteous and I had someone at my house within the hour looking at my problem they told us what was wrong with it and how much it would cost to fix and they had the problem fixed in under 24 hours and they subtracted the the consultation fee out of the total cost of the repair to make it a little cheaper on me and my family which was extremely helpful thank you all so much coming out here and getting things done so quickly if I have another AC problem I will definitely be using them again also their consultation fee was $5 cheaper than the other place I originally called so the cheaper consultation fee and their speed of service getting out here to tell me what the problem was is exactly why I chose to go with them and I'm not disappointed that I did ; we called them on Friday afternoon and Saturday morning we had cool air they were also very informative and knowledgeable they shared all the information with me and my husband to help us understand exactly what was going on with our air conditioning unit they also informed us of some other things about our central heater and our Freon tank and when our unit was the created how long it's supposed to last; they really filled us in and updated us on a lot useful information about our unit that we didn't know anything about and that will be very helpful to us in the future our central unit is very old about 15 years old and I had to go all the way to Birmingham to get the part for our old unit and I still had our AC fixed under 24 hours I'm sure for anyone out there that has an AC that's 10 years or younger they'll be even faster for y'all and I were exceptionally fast I called 3 places and they were the fastest with a real-time estimate of exactly what time they could be there to look at my AC and they were at my house 30 mins after i initially called them and asked them to come out anyways thank you for fixing our unit and to everyone out there reading this review if you're looking for a good AC company this one's a great one

name: Kathy Gwizdala
text: We recently had Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning install a Generac Generator for our home on Mobile Bay. We are so very happy with our overall experience with this company. In fact (no lie) less than two hours after the final hook-up, there was a sudden storm, the electricity went out and the generator came on. It was seamless!!! We did have a misunderstanding with the salesman but once we brought it to the attention of Steve Dukes, the business owner, he quickly and decisively took care of it. Because we are on the Bay, we wanted the generator elevated so that, should there be flooding, the generator would be safe. That request hadn't been conveyed to the installers. However, when Mr. Dukes was made aware of the oversight, he actually constructed a metal stand for us himself. Plus he did this very quickly so that the delay was minimal. We were thinking they would build us a wooden platform, but the metal one is much better — both functionally (as it will last longer) and aesthetically. We are from Michigan and we had no intention of being here through hurricane season but we had traveled here with my 94 year old mother and, because of the coronavirus, she couldn’t fly back and she can’t physically tolerate such a long drive.  I was afraid that, because of the misunderstanding, we would be relegated to the bottom of the list and have to wait until they could “get around to it” because they were so busy...not so! There was only a slight delay while the frame was fabricated. So, fast forward to the present time: We had “bugged out” when Hurricane Sally was about 100 miles South of us and just now walked into the door after Sally had passed through. There is no electricity on either side of us but we walked into the door with the generator humming reassuringly beside the house. I don’t have to worry about Moms Bi-Pap or oxygen condenser working. She will be able to sleep comfortably tonight...and so will I. Mr. Dukes made sure we had the generator installed the way we wanted it and in a timely manner, smoothing out the bumps along the way. I definitely recommend getting a whole house (Generac) generator and I highly recommend doing business with Mr. Dukes of Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning. He knows his business and is a man of integrity.

resp.text: Kathy thank you so much. It was a pleasure working with you.

name: Carrie Andrews
text: My  elderly fathers air conditioner went out suddenly and he called Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning for the first time. When the mechanic arrived he immediatly started in on a sales pitch saying the three year old a/c was not worth repairing due to its age. He wasted over thirty minutes at $100.00 an hour trying to sell us on a new unit  before he even took his tools out of his truck. After one hour into the diagnosis he tells us he needs a part and will return shortly and he leaves. We wait without a/c for over two hours for him to run to get the parts. When he returns he quickly replaces what he calls the capacitor. We had to pay $685.50 for the total repair, $125.00 of which was the part When we were cleaning up his mess we found the reciept from Solar Supply for the part he purchased. That $125.00 part cost them $6.20 , The mechanic also charged us for four pounds of freon and he never even removed the freon caps from the a/c. I feel violated and would not recommend this company to my worst enemy. I will be calling the BBB

name: Judson E Crump
text:
A bit disappointing.  3 months ago, our AC unit wasn't cooling as well as it should.  So we called Baldwin HVAC.  They sent a guy to come out and look at it.  He looked briefly at the unit, walked around the house for a few minutes with a thermometer, and quickly pronounced that there was nothing wrong, and that all we needed was to change our air filters.  So they charged us $39 for the visit (the fee they quote you) plus $50 for "labor," which I guess is that guy's rate for walking around your house for 10 minutes.

Obviously, I keep my filters changed, so I was suspicious, but I assumed that he knew what he was talking about.  2 weeks ago, our AC stops working completely.   Before calling anyone, I go into the attic and check it out myself.  The coils were completely frozen.  And not only that - they were clogged with dust and mold.  This was due to our blower motor malfunctioning, which had been happening slowly for some time at that point.

I took a photo to show how bad it was.  Naturally, I called Baldwin HVAC to ask how their guy missed something so obvious.  The manager, Anthony, said that the initial $89 visit "didn't include" looking at the coils, even though it took me - an ordinary guy with no HVAC expertise - literally 5 minutes to open up the blower and look in there.

Like an fool, I believed him, and so hired them to come out and fix the blower motor that had gone bad.  Their guy John came and he was nice and did a good job.

But the next day, the same AC unit goes dead again.  This time, the problem is the outdoor compressor.  So I call them to come check it out.

They charge us yet another $89 to come and look at the same AC system they'd worked on the very day before.  This time, we resist their high-pressure sales tactics ("It's 4 PM, so if you want the AC working tomorrow, we need to order the part now! ") and call a different company to work on the compressor.  Baldwin HVAC quoted us $822 to replace the part (which was covered by warranty).  We went to Climatemp instead, and they charged us $550 for the exact same job.  They got the part that same day and had a guy out there the very next morning.

Long story short: I'd recommend someone else first, if only because these people charge more than other companies, and in my experience, the quality of the work just wasn't sufficient to justify the extra cost.

They also told us that Trane has been having problems with there compressors since they have been bought out by ingersoll rand. We wished we would have knew this before. Buyers beware the Trane product is nothing like it use to be and this company can care less after they collect the check. There's better companies that actually stand behind their products and work out there.

They said they have been having this problem with the trane units the sales man Dan never told us that while he was selling us the unit. On top of all of this it took a week to get us the part from Trane to fix my brand new unit. Evidently Trane has a problem there brand new units quit working before they ever even get started and you can't get parts for them in a timely manner. We will never buy another Trane!!! name: Annie Klassen
text:
First, Recently moved to Tuscaloosa and hired this company based on their good reviews.
I would not hire this company. Just called for tune up and they said I needed repairs totaling $800 including parts...on a new unit. I’m a female who does her homework, called a reputable company to check. After their inspection, they said there was no mechanical issues. They put in 2lbs of Freon because someone hadn’t capped it.  They also mentioned they no one from Adams even took the cover off the unit, which I can attest to because I was standing there, but know nothing about HVAC. Buyer beware.

resp.text: Sorry about your experience in using us! My technicians are very well trained to check over your system and look for any problems with your system. If you had to add 2 lbs of refrigerant to your system, then you have a leak that wouldn't be fixed by simply caps. That is just a short term solution to your problem. We offered the long term fix for around $500, not $800. If the parts weren't under warranty would of cost you over $1500 to repair properly. Unfortunately, Newer units fail all the time. Thank you for giving us the opportunity to earn your business!

resp.text: Sorry for the delay to respond to this. I couldn't tell you how great it is to have someone leave such a great review! I really do take pride over customer service. resp.text: Sorry you feel it was a waste of time! With new refrigerant, we can't just replace the outside unit anymore. With the duct work, must of been a lot more issues than what you thought you had. More than 50% of existing homes  have improperly sized duct work. Which could be the cause of your outside unit being bad. We don’t look for the temporary fix but the permanent one. There was issues we saw that suggested replacing the duct and system to get your home properly heating and cooling. Thank you for the chance to earn your business!

resp.text: Mr. Smith, We charged you $220 for a capacitor that has a 5 year warranty on it with labor to install. The ones you see on amazon only have a 1 year with no labor. name: Lyndsay Albert
text: My air conditioning stopped working during one of the hottest days this spring. I was recommended this company from a very close friend of the owners family. I had to use the after hours service which had an up charge, but it wasn’t that significant. Being a single female, I always wonder if services try to get me to pay more because they think I don’t know what is going on, but my technician was very upfront about what was wrong with my AC unit and even told me to call back the next day during normal business hours to make an appointment to put a new thermostat in (something optional I wanted) to avoid being charged extra. Very trustworthy technician and company. I will be utilizing this company for any AC/heating issues in the future and will be recommending it to my friends.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind comments! We appreciate your business!

name: Therese Culliton
text: The service technician that came out the day before we had to have a new unit put in was extremely professional and took the time to explain what was going on with our current system and why it needed to be replaced.  I never felt that he was rushing us as he was very patient and wanted to make sure everything was explained very well.  He went further to explain that the next day they would arrive with the new unit at a certain time.  At that time, he and two other techs arrived and removed the other system again further explaining every step.  Once the new unit arrived, I was told that a Quality Control person would also be coming to inspect what was going on!  I was so impressed with this and had not seen this before.  The Quality Control guy went top to bottom over this entire unit throughout the installation process.  The professionalism of the three techs and the Quality Control man was absolutely first rate!  I will highly recommend this Company to all my friends and coworkers.  After all was said and done, I felt like I was the most important customer they had had that day.  Thanks, again, to all of you for an incredible experience!

resp.text: Therese, it was our pleasure to take care of your heating & cooling needs! We certainly appreciate your business. Thanks again...

text: I have been using Turner & Schoel for over five years now and recommend them highly to my friends and relatives.
